page.title: 20INKPEN -MEDIEVAL AND MODERN
page.content: We looked around our village to see what would have been in Medieval Inkpen that is still here today. Medieval Inkpen - Norman Church; water-mill; stream; small thatched cottages; tracks over chalk hills; common land and woodland. Modern Inkpen - tiled roofs; road signs; factory units; traffic lights; electricity cables; aeroplanes; sports ground; taps; cars and lorries, telegraph poles; swimming pools; bungalows; telephone box; pavements; combine harvester and agricultural equipment; electric lights; television aerials; post boxes and tarmac roads. Information over the 20 text pages collected and compiled by the Staff and Children at Inkpen C.P. School (not forgetting the assistance of - : - from John O'Gaunt Secondary School)
